body:
**Is this a request for help?**: No

**What keywords did you search in Kubernetes issues before filing this one?**: save-config, view-last-applied

---

**Is this a BUG REPORT or FEATURE REQUEST?** (choose one): BUG REPORT

<!--
If this is a BUG REPORT, please:
  - Fill in as much of the template below as you can.  If you leave out
    information, we can't help you as well.

If this is a FEATURE REQUEST, please:
  - Describe *in detail* the feature/behavior/change you'd like to see.

In both cases, be ready for followup questions, and please respond in a timely
manner.  If we can't reproduce a bug or think a feature already exists, we
might close your issue.  If we're wrong, PLEASE feel free to reopen it and
explain why.
-->

**Kubernetes version**:

```
Client Version: version.Info{Major:"1", Minor:"6", GitVersion:"v1.6.2", GitCommit:"477efc3cbe6a7effca06bd1452fa356e2201e1ee", GitTreeState:"clean", BuildDate:"2017-04-19T20:33:11Z", GoVersion:"go1.7.5", Compiler:"gc", Platform:"darwin/amd64"}
Server Version: version.Info{Major:"1", Minor:"5", GitVersion:"v1.5.6", GitCommit:"114f8911f9597be669a747ab72787e0bd74c9359", GitTreeState:"clean", BuildDate:"2017-03-28T13:36:31Z", GoVersion:"go1.7.4", Compiler:"gc", Platform:"linux/amd64"}
```

**Environment**:
- **Cloud provider or hardware configuration**: GKE
- **OS** (e.g. from /etc/os-release): cos

**What happened**:

Create this:

```shell
$ cat <<END | | kubectl create --save-config -f -
kind: ConfigMap
apiVersion: v1
metadata:
  name: test
data:
  myfile: |-
    This is stuff.
    %% This is more stuff.
    And also stuff.
END
configmap "test" created
```

Then we print it:

```
$ kubectl apply view-last-applied cm test
apiVersion: v1
data:
  myfile: |-
    This is stuff.
    % This is more stuff.
    And also stuff.
kind: ConfigMap
metadata:
  annotations: {}
  name: test
  namespace: staging
```

Notice that `%%` is printed as `%`. But the saved config is correct, so it's clearly a YAML-printing error:

```yaml
$ kubectl get cm test -oyaml
apiVersion: v1
data:
  myfile: |
    This is stuff.
    %% This is more stuff.
    And also stuff.
kind: ConfigMap
metadata:
  annotations:
    kubectl.kubernetes.io/last-applied-configuration: |
      {"apiVersion":"v1","data":{"myfile":"This is stuff.\n%% This is more stuff.\nAnd also stuff.\n"},"kind":"ConfigMap","metadata":{"annotations":{},"name":"test","namespace":"staging"}}
  creationTimestamp: 2017-05-10T19:55:02Z
  name: test
  namespace: staging
  resourceVersion: "8965664"
  selfLink: /api/v1/namespaces/staging/configmaps/test
  uid: 8df6ccf5-35ba-11e7-9cda-42010a8e01bd
```

This seems to be caused by `%` being interpreted as a Go format code, because I also get this for other occurrences of `%`:

```
        summary = "{{ $value }}%!r(MISSING)eplicas unavailable"
```

**What you expected to happen**:
It should print the exact saved data.

**How to reproduce it** (as minimally and precisely as possible):
See above.

labels.description: Categorizes issue or PR as related to a bug.
labels.name: kind/bug

labels.description: Categorizes an issue or PR as relevant to SIG CLI.
labels.name: sig/cli

title: "apply view-last-applied" munges format codes in YAML/JSON
